TopicTitle: Am I the only one who's creeped out by the Mun?

Articles.Content:
As the title suggest, am I?

Whenever Im on the mun I feel really lonely and uncomfortable and have a sudden urge to leave asap.

I dont have any problems with Duna. Unless its night time and Im parked next to the face.

Edited October 5, 2013 by Odo
um I think?

um I think?

Thats what I thought. Im probably just insane in my own special way
don't worry were all insane (to people who don't play ksp if you know what I mean)
When I land on the Mun, I think, "Great. I'm the first one here. Now I just need to wait until someone else comes along, and I can charge him rent."
When I first went to the mun (or the first time I got close to it) it felt like I was in deep space, far from home. Now it feels like home.

Mun seemed more desolate in 0.13 than it does now, and more intriguing. Probably because 0.13 was the first time I visited it. Then again, 0.13 was the first time I did anything in KSP...

If anywhere is creepy, I'd have to say... Ike. I just find it a little bit intimidating. How Duna has such a large moon (in relation to Duna itself) in such a low orbit (in comparison to other orbital altitudes) is just... I shudder* to think of it. Weirdly creepy. Oh well.

*No shuddering actually occurred. If you feel mislead, contact the complaints department, who will probably not be able to help you resolve this non-issue.
I like Mun. It's Dres that scares me. It's like the Mun, but way colder and more desolate.

I don't know about you guys, but I'm always freaked out when I send something down to 'land on' Jool. Come to think about it, that happens with Kerbol as well. Maybe I'm just afraid of giant planetary bodies?
The creepiest body in the game is without any doubt Eeloo. So small, so cold, so desolate, so unconditionally evil.
Im also freaked out by Kerbin's oceans. But then again Im freaked out by IRL oceans. Especially when swimming in them. I dont like the fact taht anything could be under me and I wouldnt know..

The creepiest body in the game is without any doubt Eeloo. So small, so cold, so desolate, so unconditionally evil.

I like snow. I havent landed on Eloo yet but I thought itd be fun, now that you mention it I guess it does seem kinda... odd.

I am not creeped out by any bodies (okay, maybe dres because it barely shows up in map view, its almost ghost-like) but Jool downright hates me and eats my probes for breakfast. Lost Jeb, Bill, and Bob in one craft on Lathe from running out of fuel during plane change. 5 probes crashed, eaten, slingshoted out of the system, or came in retrograde. yeah . . .

None of the planets/moons are particularly creepy to me. Fascinating, certainly, but it's hard to call a lifeless virtual chunk of rock "creepy".

Pol seems like it'd deserve that sort of designation if any of KSP's celestial bodies did. Huge valleys covered in rock spires and all that.

I personally feel very comfortable inside the kerbin sphere of influence.

Its Duna that scares me. It reminds me of...aliens. Ancient beings that once inhabited the red desert planet, possibly hiding around the corner waiting to come out and eat you alive.
Ike is probably one of the most ominous bodies in the Kerbolar system. Looks and feels like the Death Star.
Now that we're talking about creepy celestial bodies, I've always found Ike a little... well, creepy.

As the title suggest, am I?

Whenever Im on the mun I feel really lonely and uncomfortable and have a sudden urge to leave asap.

I dont have any problems with Duna. Unless its night time and Im parked next to the face.

I leave the mun right before the sun is gone, I get this weird feeling as it gets darker and darker, like things are watching me jump about.

Ike would be creepier if it still had the magic boulder

Duna is less creepy than Ike but still creepy especially with the Easter eggs and the Sstv image
MÃƒÂ¼n is awesome. It's Ike that gives me the creeps. It's just so unnaturally huge and has very low albedo.

Well speaking of scary bodies I was always a bit freaked by Tylo, this giant moon with that white almost skeletal color always doing crazy things to my manuvering around jool system. And its also so big.

I have to say, I started getting a bit scared of any of the outer planets from the dark side since I played Outer Wilds after Scott Manley showed it off. You'll get what I mean if you play it for a while.
I have to agree about the Mun, especially the poles. The whole place just seems so dead.

its a video game. come on guys.

does the moon creep you out IRL?
Didn't find it creepy exactly, but when I landed on Eeloo, I definitely got the feeling that I was a very, very long way from home.
